his
right mind thinks that a computer simulation of a five-alarm fire will burn
down the neighborhood, or that a computer simulation of an internal com-
bustion engine will power a car or that computer simulations of lactation and
photosynthesis will produce milk and sugar. To my amazement, however, I
have found that a large number of people suppose that computer simulations
of mental phenomena, whether at the level of brain processes or not, literally
produce mental phenomena.
Again, let’s try
